title: Filipino thespians who conquered Broadway and West End
text:
by Paulyn Abando
October 11, 2015 There is a call on theatre hopefuls to fill in key roles in the Rodgers and Hammerstein musical “The King And I” which goes to Singapore in February, 2016. Full House Entertainment will hold audition for the roles of Lun Tha, Tuptim, Lady Thiang, Louis Leonowens, and one of the eight wives of King Mongkut of Siam at the third floor Rehearsal Room of Newport Performing Arts Theater of Resorts World Manila. Interested? Break a leg.
‘The King and I’
To further inspire you, Bulletin Entertainment collates here some of the most remarkable Filipino talents who’ve made it big on Broadway and at West End:
LEA SALONGA
Lea Salonga
The benchmark by which all Filipino theatre actors measure world-class talent, Lea Salonga auditioned for the West End staging of “Miss Saigon” in 1989 where she landed the titular role of Kim.
The breakthrough earned her a Laurence Olivier Award (Outstanding Performance of the Year by an Actress in a Musical). She later reprised the role on Broadway and won a prestigious Tony Award for Best Leading Actress in a Musical.
Lea also has a Drama Desk, Outer Critics Circle and Theatre World Awards tucked under her belt. Whoa.
She continued to earn acclaim playing éponine in “Les Misérables,” and got to live every girl’s dream to be a Disney Princess by giving life to the singing voice of Princess Jasmine via the Grammy award-winning song “A Whole New World.” She also lent her voice to Mulan for the song “Reflection.”
The “The Voice” coach just recently returned to Broadway for “Allegiance.”
EVA NOBLEZADA
Eva Noblezada rose to fame as Kim in the 2014 London staging of “Miss Saigon.”
It was Eva’s professional West End debut after being scouted in the finals of the National High School Music Theatre Awards (aka the Jimmy Awards) in the US.
The 19-year-old star has already won the 2015 WhatsOnStage Award as Best Actress in a Musical.
JON JON BRIONES
The 50-year-old thespian was part of the original cast of “Miss Saigon” in 1989. Two decades later, he turned heads anew portraying The Engineer in the 2014 revival of the musical.
JOANNA AMPIL
Joanna Ampil’s West End credits include appearances in “Jesus Christ Superstar,” “Avenue Q,” and “Rent.” She also played the role of Fantine in the London staging of “Les Misérables” until June 2008.
The singer-actress was personally invited by Cameron Mackintosh to star as Kim in the Australian premiere of “Miss Saigon.”
Joanna was also among those who performed before 50 dignitaries, including Queen Elizabeth, during the 100th anniversary celebration of England-France relations in 2004.
Joanna is back on local shores to cast in the Pinoy musical “Chuva Choo Choo: The Mr. Kupido Musical.”
JOSE LLANA
The singer-actor has built his career starring in several Broadway shows like “Street Corner Symphony,” “Rent,” and “The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee,” where he and the entire cast won in the 2005 Drama Desk Award for Best Ensemble Performance.
Rachelle Ann Go
He has also appeared in the hit HBO Television series “Sex And The City.”
Back in 2004, Jose recorded his self-titled debut album under Viva.
The 40-year-old was last seen on Broadway via “The King And I,” replacing Ken Watanabe.
RACHELLE ANN GO
Rachelle Ann Go first gained recognition here when she emerged champion in “Search For A Star” in 2004. She has since established herself as a pop singer of note, waxing several hit records and staging big concerts.
Rachelle was among hundreds of Filipino hopefuls who made it to London by landing the role of Gigi in the 2014 “Miss Saigon” revival. The role since earned her the WhatsOnStage award for Best Supporting Actress in a Musical and the BroadwayWorld UK/West End Award for Best Featured Actress in a New Production of a Musical.
Rachelle now plays Fantine in the West End staging of “Les Misérables.” Don’t you fret monsieur, mademoiselle, as the Tony award-winning musical will come to Manila next year.
